questionText: What happens if you try to print the value of an uninitialized variable?
options: The value 0 will be printed
A random (garbage) value will be printed
The program will terminate with a compilation error
The variable's name will be printed

questionText: Which operator in C is used to get the address of a variable?

options: Declaring a variable without specifying its type
Getting the memory address of a variable
Changing a variable's value after it has been declared
Assigning a value to a variable at the moment of its declaration

questionText: Which keyword is used to create a constant (a variable that cannot be changed)?
options: constant
static
final
const

questionText: Which of the following statements about constants in C are true? (Choose all that apply)
options: A constant can be declared without an initial value
A constant must be initialized at the time of declaration
The value of a constant cannot be changed using the assignment operator =
The const keyword is placed after the variable type
correctAnswers: A constant must be initialized at the time of declaration
The value of a constant cannot be changed using the assignment operator =

questionText: How does declaring a variable differ from initializing it?
options: They are synonyms, and there is no difference
Declaration allocates memory for the variable, while initialization assigns it an initial value
Initialization is performed before the variable is declared
Declaration assigns a value, while initialization allocates memory

questionText: What will happen if you try to execute the following code: const int x; x = 10;?
options: The code will execute successfully, and the variable x will be assigned the value 10
The program will print a garbage value
A compilation error will occur because the constant was not initialized at the time of declaration
The program will crash during runtime

questionText: Write a line of code to declare and initialize a constant named speed_limit of type int with a value of 60.
After executing the code int number; number = 2 + 2 * 2;, what value will be stored in the variable number?
options: Undefined (garbage), because the variable was not initialized

questionText: According to the rules for variable names in C, which of the following is a valid variable name?
options: 2nd_place
float
totalScore
user-name
